comment: Good luck if youre not already good at math. 4 group project problems, an optional proctored midterm, proctored final and homework every week. Passed with a C after bombing the final with 20 hours of study time. Professor essentially only puts grades in the grade book, you will teach yourself everything.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Other than 3 group projects, every week was the same. Video lecture from the 80s followed by my math lab. Like any online math class, you have to teach yourself from the examples. Final must be taken in person and there was an optional midterm.

Dr. Sims was amazing! I'm good at math in general, but I struggled with Pre-Cal and Calculus. The class is definitely tough and you have to be prepared to study, but she is very quick to respond to any questions and her grading policies are crystal clear. I'm done with math, but I would definitely take another class with her if I had to.

Take this class on campus if you want anything better than a C. She doesn't offer any assistance and the only thing she actually does herself is enter grades. She will only round your grade up if you're with 0.5%. The final and midterm are both proctored and practice she provides is doesn't prepare you enough for the the actual exams.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Highly recommended. I'm not good at math at all and passed with a "C". Honestly complete the homework on time, do well on the quizzes which are the same problems as the homework, and do well on the discussion boards. You can pass even with not dong well on the final. The final exam is on ProtorU.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great professor. I took the class online so it was a self learner class with a high use of Mymathlab. Your grades are homework, discussions, quizzes (lowest dropped) and final 40% and or proctored exam 20%. You can skip the proctored and just take the final. She offers a good amount of extra credit. Highly recommend.

This class is basically for self learners. Everything is grade on mymathlab. The only thing she grades herself are the 4 group discussions. Math hw took forever to complete. Quizzes every few weeks. I failed the midterm and final. Didn't use the textbook. I taught myself the material using the "view an example" option on mymathlab.

Class was straight-forward, but would not recommend taking unless you're a self-learner, or already good in Math. You are teaching yourself everything in this class - if you get stuck you'll need to go see a tutor. The mid-term and final are 40% of overall grade. I failed both the midterm and final, but ended up with a B in the class.

This Teach was very, very difficult. The semester its self was fine. I had an A the whole class until the final that counted 40% of my grade. I didn't do well on the final and dropped my grade majorly. the Final was nothing like the study guide and misleading. NOT A GOOD TEACHER. Teachers should want success not failure.

Do not under any circumstances take this her. I read the reviews on here before and though these people are full of it.I am a straight A student who studies a lot so I thought I will do ok with this class. WRONG! Insane amount of work. 15+hr/week. Hwork, quizzes extra assignments.Mathlab set up in a way that if you stuck, that's it.STAY AWAY!!

Marlene Sims is probably one of the best professors at KSU.  Calculus is a very difficult subject and she made the class as painless as possible.  She is patient, understanding and compassionate. She is amazing and sweet!  All teachers should have 1/4 of her patience and compassion. I am very glad I took her class.

Worst teacher I have ever had.  Uses canned, confusing lectures from text book.  Makes you do unnecessary group assignments and is very little help when you have questions.  The only way I survived this course was to use a tutor.

Avoid her with all cost.  Don't take this class if you aren't good at math.  This is a online class and there are little to no interaction with the instructor.  Homework and quizzes weighing are low. Midterm and Final are weighed the heaviest.

This is the worst professor in all KSU. She has no lecture, dont bother to teacher and the homework takes hours to do it. This is one bad professor.Finals and midterm you gotta do in school. Of all of the professors I had to deal with she is worst. AVOID HER!

Most painful thing that I have ever endured. Took online, online homework is about five hours a weeks, every few weeks you have a long quiz and hard group discussion to go with your homework. On-campus mid and final that take the full two hours to complete. Brutal! Most work I have ever had in a course at KSU to date.

I took this class online - VERY bad idea with this teacher.  I have taken over 25 online classes, but this teacher seems to see it as easy money that doesn't require any time input from her.  Be prepared to teach yourself everything, if you ask a question your simply told to go on campus to get tutoring.

Online course. If you don't like teaching yourself, don't take the class. If you're comfortable with following instructions and managing your time it's an easy A. Not very advanced calc but that's the course material not the teacher. Recommended online course.

I really liked this class and the teacher. She was very helpful and understanding. She explained clearly all the topics before giving them for homework or quizes. Final was not so bad either - she did nice review which explained all the questions.
RETIRE!! Should have been a super easy class...she made it difficult & a pain to go to. DO NOT TAKE HER!

Sims is a smart lady and would probably be a good teacher for a higher level math class...NOT for Math Modeling! She ruined what might have been the only math class that I liked! She made so many mistakes that I could not follow her notes easily and she makes simple concepts very complicated. She doesn't seem to have time to answer questions.
This class wasn't easy but its calc what do you expect. She was very helpful and grades on a curve. She gives you three attempts on quizzes and counts the highest grade.

This woman is a horrible teacher. She should retire. I took this class bc i have three other classes that i thought i would have devoted most of my time to, instead my other teachers are terrific and im devoting my time to my math modeling class. This low level class should be an easy "A", instead im probably going to fail.

Mrs. Sims plays favorites. She is difficult to follow and skips around from one point to another. She doesn't grade fairly. She's scatter brained and doesn't know what she posted on Vista. She doesn't review homework. She favored a few students and will only help a few of them.  Otherwise she doesn't help at all. She's picky on wording.

pretty bad... i took her online course,she seemed preoccupied took a while to get back to emails and questions.I was borderline for a B going into the final so I was expecting a C in the class... but only b/c I didn;t do very well on the final my entire grade suffered,and she gave me a D! I thought it was rediculous considering my other work.

Math is my worst subject and I still don't know how I got out of there with a C considering I was so confused most of the semester. She doesn't help you very much if you don't understand. I had to get people around me to explain what she was talking about. Her tests are reasonable enough.

She's a nice woman but not such a good teacher. If you remember everything you did in high school your fine. Luckily I did. If not good luck. She's a tough grader and trys to make the easiest stuff really hard.

Sims is great. I'm not very good at math- and I pulled out with a high A. Come to class everyday for the notes and group work, do the homework (she doesnt take it for a grade, just for practice) and you'll be fine. Great class- I wish she would teach precal!!
She is sooo sweet! This class is very structured and easy. She is very helpful and not intemidating. We did lots of group work so that made the class much better.

She is really a good person. Somewhat scatter-brained. If you know math from high school it is easy, basically a huge review. If not, good luck! She goes through the material somewhat quick, but will help you if you need it. She takes attendance daily. Don't let her be your first choice.

Nice teacher but hard to follow. If you aren't good at Math and I mean really good at math don't take her. You can ask her to re-explain something and it never helps it usually is the original explanation.

This teacher is not very good, especially if you are not a math genius.  She moves way to quickly and uses poor teaching methods. The group work is incredibly difficult and she is unwilling to discuss test questions.  She put one method on the study guide and then counted off when I used that method on the test.  Overall, avoid this teacher...

Unclear. I was prepared to teach myself. Doesn't grade homework, but homework she does grade is LONG,INVOLVED.  Long, boring. Group projects:frustrating b/c I got a group where NONE of us understood the material, and she switched us alot. A lady in class corrected her mistakes. I felt sorry for those who were REALLY bad at math. Better at end of s

she did not take time in explaining things and she expect you to perform better. I suppose to take math 1106 for summer but because of her am thinking of dropping it. If there is another alternative, i would have prefer it.

Would not recommend her if you are not good at math like me. She is in a hurry EVERY day and does not take time to explain problems. Somewhat scatter-brained so she is always making little typos and errors. Gives out very difficult homework assignments after she vaguely explains what we are doing.

Dropped the class. Very hard. When we had ques. to ask her she said she didn't have time she had to move on. Isn't clear and does not explain basic steps before expecting you to do "big" problems.  Wouldn't recommend.

She is very confusing. She is always messing up and confusing the students more. Also, she gives project without the information that your supposed to have. I found her very hard to understand. I would not consider taking her unless you already know the material.
So she wrote the textbook, but she rambles and doesn't manage time effectively. Very easy to pass, and there a few graded assignments. She doesn't collect homework! :)

Wonderful.  Clear and helpful.  I have always been terrible at math, but I managed an A in this class.  Sims goes slow and is very clear and organized.  You can get updated info online and she will drop you lowest test grade for your final if it is higher.  The project is easy.  Best Math teacher.

Nice teacher but not a good one. Some tests were easy but some werent, esp. the FINAL, had a 78 going  into it but made a 53 on it! She said it was easy!! But she is suitable,---would suggest finding other teacher, almost everybody in my class didnt like her..
not a bad class, she really doesn't mind helping. just a lot of work. fun project to do in the class,

She will help you if you ask for it but sometimes I don't get what she is trying to explain. Her tests are long so if you get stuck on a problem just move on or you wont have time to finish.  She doesn't give any extra credit opportunities.
